byline.contributor: Vivian Yee reported from Plattsburgh, and Andy Newman from New York. Rick Rojas contributed reporting from Dannemora, N.Y., and Michael Winerip from Plattsburgh.
byline.original: By VIVIAN YEE and ANDY NEWMAN

abstract: Joyce Mitchell appears in court in Plattsburgh, NY, to face charges of helping convicted murderers Richard W Matt and David Sweat escape Clinton Correctional Facility in early June; authorities are still searching for the men; Mitchell pleads not guilty, and faces up to seven years in prison if convicted.
lead_paragraph: The Clinton County district attorney, Andrew Wylie, said that additional charges against Ms. Mitchell, as well as additional arrests, were possible.

headline.main: Joyce Mitchell, Prison Worker, Appears in Court as Search for Escaped Convicts Continues
headline.print_headline: Prison Worker Appears in Court in Escape Case and Is Assigned a New Lawyer

snippet: The Clinton County district attorney, Andrew Wylie, said that additional charges against Ms. Mitchell, as well as additional arrests, were possible.
